The inner parentheses around (num + factor) are redundant due to left-to-right associativity of +/-. Keep a single pair around the whole numerator to preserve (a+b-1)/c semantics.
Relational operators have lower precedence than addition/subtraction; the subtraction is evaluated before the comparison without parentheses.

Extra parentheses around (i * n + j) are unnecessary due to left-to-right associativity of +/-. Index precedence is unambiguous.
Parentheses around the additive chain are unnecessary; + associates left-to-right.
The outer parentheses around the index expression are unnecessary. Keep (1 + i) to force addition before multiplication.
The outer parentheses around the index expression are unnecessary. Keep (i - 1) to force subtraction before multiplication.
Collapse nested additive parentheses into a single pair around the full sum. One pair is needed to ensure the entire sum is divided; the inner nestings are redundant.
Function argument parentheses are unnecessary; subtraction is evaluated before the comma separation.
